message: Hi Bob, I have a great product that I think you'll love. I'm willing to offer it to you for $150.
I'm interested in the product, but $150 is a bit steep for me. I was thinking more along the lines of $120.
I understand that $150 is a bit high for you, but I really need to make a profit on this sale. I'm willing to meet you halfway at $135. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still a bit short on budget. Would you be willing to go down to $125?
I can see you're really interested in the product, but I'm not ready to go as low as $125 just yet. I'm willing to go down to $130, but that's as low as I can go. What do you think?
I appreciate your flexibility, but $130 is still a bit out of my budget. Would you be willing to meet me at $128?

I'm starting to get a bit concerned that we might not meet in the middle, Bob. I'm willing to make one more concession, but I need to get closer to my minimum price. I'm willing to go down to $132, but that's as low as I can go. What do you think?
I understand that you're trying to get closer to your minimum price, but I'm still a bit short on budget. Would you be willing to meet me at $129?

I'm not willing to go any lower than $132, and I'm starting to think we're getting close to the end of the negotiation. I'm willing to make a final offer of $131. If you're not willing to meet me there, I'll have to consider other options.

I appreciate your final offer, but I'm still a bit short on budget. I'm willing to meet you at $130, and that's as low as I can go. If you're not willing to meet me there, I'll have to consider buying from John for $100.
